alternative_parents.description: Polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a benzene ring linked to a pyrrolidine ring through a CC or CN bond. Pyrrolidine is a five-membered saturated aliphatic heterocycle with one nitrogen atom and four carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Phenylpyrrolidines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a piperidine ring which bears two ketones.
alternative_parents.name: Piperidinediones

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a benzene with exactly two chlorine atoms attached to it.
alternative_parents.name: Dichlorobenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Cyclic organic compounds containing a piperidin-2-one moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Delta lactams

alternative_parents.description: Pyrrolidines which bear a C=O group at position 2 of the pyrrolidine ring.
alternative_parents.name: Pyrrolidine-2-ones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acyl chloride functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl chlorides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds comprising an N-substituted carboxylic acid imide group, with the general structure R1N(C(R2)=O)C(R3)=O (R2,R3=H, alkyl, aryl; R1=Anything but H).
alternative_parents.name: N-substituted carboxylic acid imides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyrrole ring, which is a five-member aromatic heterocycle with one nitrogen atom and four carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Pyrroles

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acid amides in which the two acyl groups linked to the central nitrogen atoms are carboacyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Dicarboximides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

class.description: Compounds containing a piperidine ring, which is a saturated aliphatic six-member ring with one nitrogen atom and five carbon atoms.
class.name: Piperidines

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenylpiperidines. These are compounds containing a phenylpiperidine skeleton, which consists of a piperidine bound to a phenyl group.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing a phenylpiperidine skeleton, which consists of a piperidine bound to a phenyl group.
direct_parent.name: Phenylpiperidines

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds containing a phenylpiperidine skeleton, which consists of a piperidine bound to a phenyl group.
subclass.name: Phenylpiperidines

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
